title: Logo with two interlocking hands
content: I am trying to find/remember a logo with two interlocking hands in a kind of yin and yang way (i.e it has rotational symmetry (within a circle, I think). Think it might be a UK logo but I'm not absolutely sure. Anyone know it?
author: Nick Job

comments.content:
category of product or service?

-=®=-
Haven't got a clue, just know that it's two hands interlocking in a rotationally symmetrical fashion.

There are literally myriads of logos with two hands:

Just a sample:  
 [The Boys & Girls Clubs of Manatee](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.bgcofmanatee.org/index.php)  
 [Declaration of Independence Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.declarationfilmfest.org/)  
Nice one: [Logo by Christian Palino](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.christianpalino.com/index2.html) (\>Logo Marks\>top left)  
 [Helping Hands Ministry](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.hosannacf.org/hosanna/cwp/view.asp?A=1255&Q=457698)  
 [National Association of Black Accountants](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.nabainc.org/AboutNABA/AbouttheLogo/tabid/302/Default.aspx)  
Or the [SED logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:SED_Logo.svg)? No, not very much Yin&Yang in it … ;^)
The one I'm thinking of is based on a circle or ellipse and the hands are not shaking as such but flowing into each other. The whole thing has rotation symmetry.

Not that it helps, but I can bring to mind the one you're talking about, Nick. Smoothly rounded curvilinear fingers, right? One white hand, one black... I've definitely seen it somewhere. I'll have a look in "A Smile in the Mind" later to see if it's in there somewhere...

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Ever since I chose to block pop-ups, my toaster's stopped working.
I can picture it too. Counselling… advice… legal… ?

I think I MIGHT have been thinking about this old CRE logo, but I'm not sure.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_40025225_cre_logo_203_5395.jpg)

Four hands in a fireman's carry - I definitely remember seeing that but can't put my finger on what it was for…

Insurance company?

pbc

Hmm, the CRE one isn't what _I_ was thinking of, but it's Nick's question!  
It wasn't in "A Smile in the Mind", nor in the "Logo Font & Lettering Bible" so wherever I did see it was probably in actual use...

Frustrating.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Ever since I chose to block pop-ups, my toaster's stopped working.

Ah finally! Found it! (At least the one I was thinking of)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227im_/http:/typophile.com/files/opp_logo_4138.gif)

That's the one I was thinking of - just couldn't put 2 and 3 together…

pbc

Not the one I was thinking of I'm afraid.

The one I'm thinking of has just two hands. They are the same hand rotated through 180 degrees. It is within a circular device. May well be a UK logo, as I already said. Aaargh!
Could it be this one: [Conservatives. Moving Britain forward](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/98352291@N00/166550760/)?
Not it but much closer to the one I have in mind.

See if this link will do work for you: [http://logoblink.com/2008/02/23/logos-hands/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/logoblink.com/2008/02/23/logos-hands/)  
There is one in black and red which might be what you're looking for.
sounds like Bass...?

That black and red one is certainly very close to what _I_ was visualising: but I guess Nick's hoping to find who it is that actually _has_ a logo like that... Quite frustrating!

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Ever since I chose to block pop-ups, my toaster's stopped working.

I was thinking of a very similar logo. I came across this one on my travels:

[http://www.fontana.org/images/environ/reuse\_logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133227/http:/www.fontana.org/images/environ/reuse_logo.jpg)

to be honest the one I had in mind had two hands.
Dave (dtw), that's 'exactly' (I think) what I had in mind but whose logo is it???
Frustrating, ain't it?
Someone must know the answer somewhere??????? Arggggghhhhhh!
